replies.body: what do I do when I have 6 Sunfire capes?
Sell one so you have the space to buy another
Isn't 6 enough?
No, you're AP.
Instructions unclear. Dick stuck in bush.

> [{quoted}](name=WyvernEgg,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=W7qqYn5H,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-01-10T20:26:39.362+0000)
>
> Isn't 6 enough?

sell your trinket and buy another one
By that time {{champion:36}} 's Burning Agony is not even comparable toward your 7 {{item:3068}}  build.

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA



No.
That's literally garen for you, easiest champ in league.
{{champion:19}} You what.

Are you level 6? > No > Farm > Return to start.
　　　　　　　　　　　> Yes > ult.
garen is easier than warwick
Nah, Garen has 4 activated abilities, Warwick only has 3 ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
lol do people actually use his w?
30% reduced damage for 6 seconds? Why wouldn't you use it?
6 SECONDS??? wasnt it like 2 seconds?
2 at rank 1, up to 6 at rank 5
Yeah, it's useful in some situations. Smidge extra damage from auto-attacks in a relatively even fight can mean the difference of life and death!
in duels and team fights yes, but anything else, it isnt really that useful i find. Mind you, i dont play garen that much
but warwick isn't as op as garen, so garen is much easier to get fed with

Well, yeah, new players need SOMETHING that they can play with any level of proficiency. There's nothing wrong with having a simple champion, with mechanical simplicity comes predictability, it balances out in the end.

"No I'm AP"
lol I love how that's included in this chart
That's from when DFG existed....
God bless Magic Pen Garen
Archmage Garen OP

I mean Garen and Kata and Ryze have the faceslam thing in common. There's definitely depth and complexity to their gameplay in knowing when to go in and such, but once the fight starts they all basically push the buttons and wait for the other people to die.
